StoryFormats.DescriptionFormat: #PA1# has $LO$ #TA1qcLO#. Then #PA1qg# buys $RO$ more. How many #TA1qcPL# does #PA1# has now?
#PA1# has $LO$ #TA1qcLO#. Then #PA1qg# gives $RO$ of them to #PA2#. How many does #PA1# has left?
#PA1# has $LO$ #AA1qcLO# that each drink $RO$ buckets of water. How many buckets does #PA1# need to have?
#PA1# has $LO$ #FA1qcLO# and $RO$ hungry #AA1qcRO#. How many #FA1qcPL# can #PA1# give to each #AA1qcSI#?
#PA1# has some #TA1qcPL#. Then #PA1qg# buys $RO$ more and now #PA1qg# has $TO$ of them. How many #TA1qcPL# did #PA1qg# had at the beginning?
#PA1# has some #TA1qcPL#. Then #PA1qg# gives $RO$ of them to #PA2# and now #PA1# has $TO$ #TA1qcTO#. How many #TA1qcPL# did #PA1# had at the beginning?
#PA1# has some #AA1qcPL#. Each #AA1qcSI# drinks $RO$ buckets of water. #PA1# needs $TO$ buckets for all of them. How many #AA1qcPL# does #PA1# have?
In a party there are some #FA1qcPL#. $RO$ friends split the #FA1qcPL# in equal parts and each has $TO$ #FA1qcTO#. How many #FA1qcPL# were there at the beginning?
#PA1# has $LO$ #TA1qcLO#. Then #PA1qg# buys some more and now #PA1qg# has $TO$ of them. How many #TA1qcPL# did #PA1qg# buy?
#PA1# has $LO$ #TA1qcLO#. Then #PA1qg# gives some of them to #PA2# and now #PA1# has $TO$ #TA1qcTO#. How many #TA1qcPL# did #PA1# gave away?
$LO$ friends get together. Each brings some #TA1qcPL# to play. All together they have $TO$ #TA1qcTO#. How many #TA1qcPL# did each friend bring?
In a party there are $LO$ #FA1qcLO#, enough to give each guest $TO$ #FA1qcTO#. How many guests are at the party?
